org.extricate.minimud
Class Server

java.lang.Object
  java.lang.Thread
      org.extricate.minimud.Server
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.lang.Runnable
public class Server
extends java.lang.Thread

A very basic MUD (Multi User Dungeon) server, designed to be accessed by clients using the "telnet" protocol.

Version:
1.0
Author:
Tristan Greaves

Field Detail

DEFAULT_PORT

public static final int DEFAULT_PORT
The default port for the MUD to run on, if not specified on the command line.

Path of where to find our data files.

Constructor Detail

Server

public Server(int port)
Begins listening for connections, then launches the thread to handle them.

Parameters:
port - Port to bind server to
Method Detail

fail

public static void fail(java.lang.Exception e,
                        java.lang.String text)
Exits Minimud when another part of the program throws a particularly nasty exception. The exception along with a textual explanation is sent to the screen.

Parameters:
e - Exception
text - Description of failure

log

public static void log(java.lang.String text)
Logs MiniMUD activity (time/date stamped). At the moment, we only output to System.out (instead of a file).

Parameters:
text - Text to log

run

public void run()
Sits waiting for client connections. When a client connects, a new "Connection" thread is spawned for each one.

Specified by:
run in interface java.lang.Runnable
Overrides:
run in class java.lang.Thread

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
Handles any command line arguments. The user can pass the port they want to use via the command line if they desire. If everything is okay a new Minimud is created.

Parameters:
args - Command line arguments
